Implement a Multi-Factor Authentication System: A multi-factor authentication system can be implemented to ensure that only authorized personnel can access sensitive data and systems. This can include biometric authentication such as fingerprint or facial recognition, as well as the use of smart cards or tokens.

Encrypt Data at Rest and in Transit: All data should be encrypted both at rest and in transit to prevent unauthorized access. This can be done using industry-standard encryption algorithms such as AES-256.

Implement a Network Segmentation Strategy: A network segmentation strategy can be implemented to limit the spread of malware and prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data. This can involve creating separate networks for different departments or functions within the company.

Conduct Regular Security Audits: Regular security audits can be conducted to identify vulnerabilities and ensure that security measures are up-to-date and effective. This can involve penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, and social engineering tests.

Provide Employee Training: Employee training can be provided to raise awareness about cyber security threats and best practices. This can include training on password management, phishing awareness, and safe browsing habits.
